definition: to take sth to be true
letter/mail/CL:封[feng1]/to trust/to believe/to profess faith in/truthful/confidence/trust/at will/at random
old variant of 以[yi3]
to use/by means of/according to/in order to/because of/at (a certain date or place)
abbr. for Israel 以色列[Yi3 se4 lie4]
old variant of 以[yi3]
variant of 為|为[wei4], because of/for/to
because of/for/to
variant of 為|为[wei2]/as (i.e. in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do
as (in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do/by (in the passive voice)
really/truly/indeed/real/true/genuine

sentences.english: Do not believe just because it fits with one's point of view.
sentences.chinese: 不可只因符合个人见解，就信以为真。

sentences.english: Do not believe just because the speaker appears believable.
sentences.chinese: 不可只因说者看似可信，就信以为真。

sentences.english: GeMei use opportunely lies deceive summer sun yat sen villa, summer sun yat sen villa sumption.
sentences.chinese: 葛眉巧用谎言欺骗夏晚晴，夏晚晴信以为真。

sentences.english: Lin Yuhui face rising concern for gospel truth.
sentences.chinese: 林语慧信以为真，脸上升起担忧。

sentences.english: Do not believe merely because it is hearsay.
sentences.chinese: 不可只因常听人这么说，就信以为真。
不谙世事的谭小燕信以为真。

sentences.english: The king took it for true and appointed Zhao Kuo as the general commander in place of Lian Po.
sentences.chinese: 赵王信以为真，就让赵括取代廉颇，统领全军。

sentences.english: Or so it was believed until the news about the little English pots.
sentences.chinese: 大家信以为真，直到出现英国瓷罐的新闻。

sentences.english: Given Reed's track record, why does anyone take him seriously?
sentences.chinese: 里德的记录明摆着，为什么还是有人信以为真呢？

definition: to believe firmly without any doubt (idiom)/absolute certainty about sth
to falsely believe/to be mislead/to fall for (a trick etc)
to listen to information/to get the news/to believe what one hears
to easily trust/gullible/naïve
swindler/a cheat
to claim/to pretend
half doubting/dubious/skeptical
to deceive/to cheat
half believing, half doubting/skeptical
to compile/to draw up/to fabricate/to invent/to concoct/to make up/to cook up
to rock/to sway/to flicker (e.g. of lights reflected on water)/to flutter (e.g. of a flag)/to trick sb into doing sth/to dupe/to con
taken in (by sb's deceit)/to be fooled/to be duped
to defraud/to swindle
to cheat/to swindle/to deceive/to get on (a horse etc) by swinging one leg over
graceful words, flowery speech (idiom); elegant but insincere words/cheating wheedling/dishonest rhetoric
to cheat sb/a scam
